CreateStreamLinkFlow.document: This API is used to create a StreamLink flow.
CreateStreamLinkFlow.name: Creates a StreamLink flow

CreateStreamLinkOutputInfo.document: This API is used to create a StreamLink output.
CreateStreamLinkOutputInfo.name: Creates a StreamLink output

DeleteStreamLinkFlow.document: This API is used to delete a StreamLink flow.
DeleteStreamLinkFlow.name: Deletes a StreamLink flow

DeleteStreamLinkOutput.document: This API is used to delete an output of a StreamLink flow.
DeleteStreamLinkOutput.name: Deletes a StreamLink output

DescribeStreamLinkFlow.document: This API is used to query the configuration information of a StreamLink flow.
DescribeStreamLinkFlow.name: Queries a StreamLink flow

DescribeStreamLinkFlowLogs.document: This API is used to query the logs of a StreamLink flow.
DescribeStreamLinkFlowLogs.name: Queries the logs of a flow

DescribeStreamLinkFlowMediaStatistics.document: This API is used to query the media quality of a StreamLink flow.
DescribeStreamLinkFlowMediaStatistics.name: Queries the media quality.

DescribeStreamLinkFlowRealtimeStatus.document: This API is used to query the current status of a flow.
DescribeStreamLinkFlowRealtimeStatus.name: Queries the current status of a flow.

DescribeStreamLinkFlowSRTStatistics.document: This API is used to query the SRT streaming performance of a StreamLink flow.
DescribeStreamLinkFlowSRTStatistics.name: Queries SRT streaming performance

DescribeStreamLinkFlowStatistics.document: This API is used to query the media quality of a StreamLink flow.
DescribeStreamLinkFlowStatistics.name: Queries the media quality of a flow

DescribeStreamLinkFlows.document: This API is used to query the configuration information of multiple StreamLink flows in batches.
DescribeStreamLinkFlows.name: Queries StreamLink flows in batches

DescribeStreamLinkRegions.document: This API is used to query all StreamLink regions.
DescribeStreamLinkRegions.name: Queries StreamLink regions

ModifyStreamLinkFlow.document: This API is used to modify the configuration information of a StreamLink flow.
ModifyStreamLinkFlow.name: Modifies a StreamLink flow

ModifyStreamLinkInput.document: This API is used to modify an input of a StreamLink flow.
ModifyStreamLinkInput.name: Modifies an input

ModifyStreamLinkOutputInfo.document: This API is used to modify an output of a StreamLink flow.
ModifyStreamLinkOutputInfo.name: Modifies an output

StartStreamLinkFlow.document: This API is used to start a StreamLink flow.
StartStreamLinkFlow.name: Starts a StreamLink flow

StopStreamLinkFlow.document: This API is used to stop a StreamLink flow.
StopStreamLinkFlow.name: Stops a StreamLink flow

CreateInput.document: Configuration information of the created input.

members.document: Input name, which can contain 1 to 32 letters, digits, and underscores.
members.name: InputName

members.document: Allowlist of input IPs in CIDR format.
members.name: AllowIpList

CreateInputRTPSettings.document: RTP configuration information of the created input.

members.document: Idle timeout period in ms. Default value: 5000. Value range: [1000, 10000].
members.name: IdleTimeout

CreateInputSRTSettings.document: SRT configuration information of the created input.

members.document: The SRT mode. Valid values: LISTENER (default), CALLER.
members.name: Mode

members.document: Stream ID, which can contain 0 to 512 letters, digits, and special characters (.#!:&,=_-).
members.name: StreamId

members.document: Latency in ms. Default value: 0. Value range: [0, 3000].
members.name: Latency

members.document: Receive latency in ms. Default value: 120. Value range: [0, 3000].
members.name: RecvLatency

members.document: Peer latency in ms. Default value: 0. Value range: [0, 3000].
members.name: PeerLatency

members.document: Peer timeout period in ms. Default value: 5000. Value range: [1000, 10000].
members.name: PeerIdleTimeout

members.document: Decryption key, which is empty by default, indicating not to encrypt. Only ASCII codes can be filled. Length: [10, 79].
members.name: Passphrase

members.document: Key length. Default value: 0. Valid values: 0, 16, 24, 32.
members.name: PbKeyLen

members.document: The SRT peer address, which is required if `Mode` is `CALLER`. Only one address is allowed.
members.name: SourceAddresses

CreateOutputInfo.document: The information of the output to create.

members.document: The output protocol. Valid values: SRT, RTP, RTMP, RTMP_PULL.
members.name: Protocol

members.document:
The IP allowlist. The address must be in CIDR format, such as `0.0.0.0/0`.
This parameter is valid if `Protocol` is set to `RTMP_PULL`. If it is left empty, there is no restriction on clients’ IP addresses.
members.name: AllowIpList

CreateOutputInfoRTPSettings.document: The RTP configuration of the output to create.

members.document: The relay destination addresses. One or two addresses are allowed.
members.name: Destinations

members.document: This parameter must be set to `none`.
members.name: FEC

CreateOutputRTMPSettings.document: The RTMP configuration of the output to create.

members.document: The relay destination addresses. One or two addresses are allowed.
members.name: Destinations

members.document: The RTMP chunk size. Value range: [4096, 40960].
members.name: ChunkSize

CreateOutputRTPSettingsDestinations.document: The RTP destination address of the output to create.

CreateOutputRtmpSettingsDestinations.document: The RTMP destination address of the output to create.

CreateOutputSrtSettings.document: The SRT configuration of the output to create.

members.document: The relay destination address, which is required if `Mode` is `CALLER`. Only one address is allowed.
members.name: Destinations

members.document: The stream ID for relay, which can contain 0 to 512 letters, digits, and special characters (.#!:&,=_-).
members.name: StreamId

members.document: The total latency (ms) of SRT relay. Value range: [0, 3000]. Default: 0.
members.name: Latency

members.document: The receive latency (ms) of SRT relay. Value range: [0, 3000]. Default: 120.
members.name: RecvLatency

members.document: The peer-to-peer latency (ms) of SRT relay. Value range: [0, 3000]. Default: 0.
members.name: PeerLatency

members.document: The timeout period (ms) for the SRT relay peer. Value range: [1000, 10000]. Default: 5000.
members.name: PeerIdleTimeout

members.document: The encryption key for SRT relay, which is empty by default, indicating not to encrypt. Only ASCII codes are allowed. Length: [10, 79].
members.name: Passphrase

members.document: The key length for SRT relay. Valid values: 0 (default), 16, 24, 32.
members.name: PbKeyLen

members.document: The SRT mode. Valid values: LISTENER, CALLER (default).
members.name: Mode

CreateOutputSrtSettingsDestinations.document: The SRT destination address of the output to create.

members.document: Maximum bandwidth in bps. Valid values: `10000000`, `20000000`, `50000000`
members.name: MaxBandwidth

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The output configuration of the flow.
members.name: Output

members.document: The information of the created output.
members.name: Info

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

DescribeFlow.document: Configuration information of the queried flow.

members.document:
Output group.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: OutputGroup

DescribeInput.document: Configuration information of the queried input.

members.document:
Input description.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Description

members.document:
SRT configuration information of input.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: SRTSettings

members.document:
RTP configuration information of input.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: RTPSettings

members.document: RTMP configuration information of an input

members.document:
Input failover
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.

DescribeInputRTMPSettings.document: RTMP configuration information of the queried input

members.document:
Path for RTMP stream pushing
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: AppName

members.document:
StreamKey for RTMP stream pushing
Format of an RTMP stream pushing URL: rtmp://IP address:1935/AppName/StreamKey
members.name: StreamKey

DescribeInputRTPSettings.document: RTP configuration information of the queried input.

DescribeInputSRTSettings.document: SRT configuration information of the queried input.

members.document:
The SRT mode.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.
members.name: Mode

members.document:
The SRT peer address.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.
members.name: SourceAddresses

DescribeOutput.document: Configuration information of the queried output.

members.document:
Output description.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Description

members.document:
Output region.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: OutputRegion

members.document:
SRT configuration information of output.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: SRTSettings

members.document:
RTP configuration information of output.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: RTPSettings

members.document:
RTMP configuration information of output.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

members.document:
RTMP pull configuration of the output
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: RTMPPullSettings

members.document:
CIDR allowlist
This parameter is valid if `Protocol` is set to `RTMP_PULL`. If this parameter is left empty, there is no restriction on clients’ IP addresses.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: AllowIpList

DescribeOutputRTMPPullServerUrl.document: RTMP pull URL of the output

members.document: Stream key of the RTMP pull URL

members.document:
List of pull URLs
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.

DescribeOutputRTMPSettings.document: RTMP configuration information of the queried output.

members.document:
Idle timeout period.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

members.document:
Chunk size.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ChunkSize

members.document:
Destination address information list of RTMP push.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Destinations

DescribeOutputRTPSettings.document: RTP configuration information of the queried output.

members.document:
Destination address information list of RTP push.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Destinations

members.document:
Whether it is FEC.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: FEC

members.document:
Idle timeout period.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: IdleTimeout

DescribeOutputSRTSettings.document: SRT configuration information of the queried output.

members.document:
A list of the destination addresses for relay. This parameter is valid if `Mode` is `CALLER`.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.

Stream ID.

The server’s listen address, which is valid if `Mode` is `LISTENER`.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.
members.name: SourceAddresses

members.document:
The start time for query, which is 1 hour ago by default. You can query statistics in the last 7 days.
It must be in UTC format, such as `2020-01-01T12:00:00Z`.
members.name: StartTime

members.document:
The end time for query, which is 1 hour after the start time by default. The longest time range allowed for query is 24 hours.
It must be in UTC format, such as `2020-01-01T12:00:00Z`.
members.name: EndTime

members.document: Whether to query the inputs or outputs. Valid values: input, output.
members.name: Type

members.document: Whether to query the primary or backup pipeline. Valid values: 0, 1.
members.name: Pipeline

members.document: The page size. Value range: [1, 1000]. Default: 100.
members.name: PageSize

members.document: Whether to sort the records by timestamp in descending or ascending order. Valid values: desc (default), asc.
members.name: SortType

members.document: The page number. Value range: [1, 1000]. Default: 1.
members.name: PageNum

members.document: The number of records per page.
members.name: PageSize

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Whether to query the inputs or outputs. Valid values: input, output.
members.name: Type

members.document: Whether to query the primary or backup pipeline. Valid values: 0, 1.
members.name: Pipeline

members.document:
The start time for query, which is 1 hour ago by default. You can query statistics in the last 7 days.
It must be in UTC format, such as `2020-01-01T12:00:00Z`.
members.name: StartTime

members.document:
The end time for query, which is 1 hour after the start time by default. The longest time range allowed for query is 24 hours.
It must be in UTC format, such as `2020-01-01T12:00:00Z`.
members.name: EndTime

members.document: A list of the media data.
members.name: Infos

members.name: RequestId

members.document: The IDs of the inputs to query. If this parameter and `OutputIds` are both empty, all inputs and outputs are queried.
members.name: InputIds

members.document: The IDs of the outputs to query. If this parameter and `OutputIds` are both empty, all inputs and outputs are queried.
members.name: OutputIds

FlowAudio.document: The audio data of the flow.

members.document: Whether it is an input or output.
members.name: Type

members.document: Whether it is a primary or backup pipeline. Valid values: 0 (primary), 1 (backup).
members.name: Pipeline

FlowMediaAudio.document: The audio data of a flow.

members.document: The ID of a push session.
members.name: SessionId

FlowMediaInfo.document: The media data of a flow.

members.document: The video data of the flow.
members.name: Video

members.document: The audio data of the flow.
members.name: Audio

members.document: The ID of a push session.
members.name: SessionId

FlowMediaVideo.document: The video data of a flow.

members.document: The ID of a push session.
members.name: SessionId

FlowRealtimeStatusCommon.document: The common real-time status information of a flow.

members.document: The connection status. Valid values: Connected, Waiting, Idle.
members.name: State

members.document: The connection mode. Valid values: Listener, Caller.
members.name: Mode

FlowRealtimeStatusItem.document: The real-time status information of a flow.

members.document: Whether it is an input or output. Valid values: Input, Output.
members.name: Type

members.document: The input ID, which is not empty if `Type` is `Input`.
members.name: InputId

members.document: The output ID, which is not empty if `Type` is `Output`.
members.name: OutputId

members.document: The protocol used. Valid values: SRT, RTP, RTMP.
members.name: Protocol

members.document:
This parameter is returned if `Protocol` is `SRT`.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.
members.name: SRTStatus

members.document:
This parameter is returned if `Protocol` is `RTMP`.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.
members.name: RTMPStatus

members.document:
This parameter is returned if the RTP protocol is used.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.
members.name: RTPStatus

FlowRealtimeStatusRTMP.document: The real-time RTMP streaming information of a flow.

FlowRealtimeStatusRTP.document: The real-time RTP streaming information of a flow.

FlowRealtimeStatusSRT.document: The real-time SRT streaming information of a flow.

members.document: The number of packets sent or received.
members.name: Packets

members.document: Whether to encrypt the stream. Valid values: On, Off.
members.name: Encryption

members.document: The packet loss rate for sending.
members.name: SendPacketLossRate

members.document: The packet loss rate for receiving.
members.name: RecvPacketLossRate

members.document: The ID of a push session.
members.name: SessionId

members.document: The number of dropped packets for sending.
members.name: SendPacketDropNumber

members.document: The number of dropped packets for receiving.
members.name: RecvPacketDropNumber

FlowStatisticsArray.document: A list of the flow statistics.

members.document: The statistics of all the sessions.
members.name: FlowStatistics

FlowVideo.document: The video data of a flow.

members.document: The IP addresses (CIDR) allowed to push streams.
members.name: AllowIpList

members.document:
The input protocol. Valid values: SRT, RTP, RTMP.
If there is an RTP input, the output must be RTP.
If there is an RTMP input, the output must be SRT or RTMP.
If there is an SRT input, the output must be SRT.
members.name: Protocol

members.document: Whether to enable input failover. Valid values: OPEN, CLOSE.
members.name: FailOver

members.document: The ID of the output to modify.
members.name: OutputId

members.document: The output protocol. Valid values: SRT, RTP, RTMP.
members.name: Protocol

members.document:
The IP allowlist. The address must be in CIDR format, such as `0.0.0.0/0`.
This parameter is valid if `Protocol` is set to `RTMP_PULL`. If it is left empty, there is no restriction on clients’ IP addresses.
members.name: AllowIpList

members.document: Name of the flow to modify
members.name: FlowName

OutputSRTSourceAddressResp.document: The listen address for an SRT output.

members.name: Url

members.document: Destination `StreamKey` of RTMP push in the format of 'streamid?key=value'.
members.name: StreamKey

RTPAddressDestination.document: Destination address information of RTP push.
